Simplify the following trigonometric expression:

(2sin^2(x) - 1)(1 + cos(x)) - sin(x)cos(x) when x = pi/6.
message_2:
First, let's find the values of sin(x), cos(x), and sin^2(x) when x = pi/6.

sin(pi/6) = 1/2
cos(pi/6) = √3/2
sin^2(pi/6) = (1/2)^2 = 1/4

Now, substitute these values into the given expression:

(2sin^2(x) - 1)(1 + cos(x)) - sin(x)cos(x) = (2(1/4) - 1)(1 + √3/2) - (1/2)(√3/2)

Simplify the expression:

(1/2 - 1)(3/2) - (√3/4) = (-1/2)(3/2) - (√3/4) = -3/4 - √3/4

Combine the terms:

(-3 - √3)/4

So, the simplified trigonometric expression is (-3 - √3)/4 when x = pi/6.
